source_sentence: 佛說月光菩薩經
translation: Sutra of the Bodhisattva Moonlight

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚少卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra of the Buddha, Tathāgata, and Young Secretary of the Court

source_sentence: 明教大師臣法賢奉　詔譯
translation: Mingjiao dashi ministers, Faxian, in accordance with the imperial edict, translated

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在王舍城竹林精舍，與大苾芻眾，而為說法。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the Veḷuvana monastery in Rājagṛha with a large congregation of monks and nuns, and he was teaching the Dharma.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗、大目乾連，前詣佛所，五體投地，禮佛足已，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana then went to the Buddha, threw their five bodies to the ground, saluted his feet, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等今者，不忍見佛入於圓寂，而於此時，先入滅度。」
translation: Now, we couldn't bear to see the Buddha enter into perfect extinction and, at this point, precede him into extinction."

source_sentence: 爾時眾中，有一苾芻，合掌向佛，而作是言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, a monk among the crowd put his palms together and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 舍利弗、大目乾連，有何因緣，今於佛前，先欲入滅？
translation: Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana, what were the reasons why you first wanted to enter into extinction before the Buddha?

source_sentence: 唯願世尊，為解眾疑。」
translation: May the Bhagavān help to resolve the many doubts."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，告苾芻言：「汝今諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "Now, listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾為汝說。
translation: "I'll explain it for you.

source_sentence: 舍利弗、大目乾連，貪瞋癡等諸漏斷盡，所作已辦，梵行已立，不受後有，非唯今日先欲入滅。
translation: "Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana, once the contaminants of greed and anger and delusion have ended, the task has been accomplished, the religious practice has been established, and I won't be subject to a later existence, not just today when I first want to enter into extinction.

source_sentence: 於過去世，北印度內，有一大城，名曰賢石，長十二由旬，廣闊亦爾。
translation: In a past life, there was a large city named Xiangshi in northern India that was 12 leagues long and similarly wide.

source_sentence: 彼有國王，名為月光，壽四萬歲，有天眼、宿命通，身色端嚴，諸相具足，光明照耀，如天滿月；所往之處，不假燈燭日月之明，故號月光。
translation: There was a king there named Moonlight, who lived 40,000 years, had the divine eye and the power of past lives, had an ornate body with an array of features, and shone like the full moon in the sky; wherever he went, he didn't need the light of a candle or the brightness of the sun or moon, so he was called Moonlight.

source_sentence: 統領四洲六萬八千國土。
translation: He rules 68,000 lands on the four continents.

source_sentence: 時世豐熟，人民安隱，金銀珍寶，飲食衣服，象馬車乘，悉皆盈滿。
translation: The world is abundant, the people are peaceful, and there's an abundance of gold, silver, jewelry, food and clothing, and elephants, horses, and carriages.

source_sentence: 於城四門，皆有樓閣，戶牖軒窻，俱用眾寶而為嚴飾；街巷道陌，掃灑清淨，竪立幢幡寶蓋，真珠瓔珞。
translation: At the city's four gates, there are towers and mansions, and their windows, doors, and windows are decorated with various treasures; the streets and lanes are cleansed and cleared, and banners, streamers, and jeweled canopies are erected, with genuine beads and jewelry.

source_sentence: 復有沈香、粖香、栴檀之香，微風時起，吹其香氣，周徧國城，車馬行人，不聞穢氣。
translation: There's also the scent of sinking incense, sandalwood, and sandalwood, and when a gentle breeze rises, it blows its fragrance all around the city, so that carts and horses and pedestrians don't hear the foul odor.

source_sentence: 處處復有花果樹木——多摩羅樹、迦尼迦囉樹、無優樹、貝多樹、娑羅樹、帝羅迦樹、龍花樹、末俱羅樹、阿底目伽樹、播吒羅樹、繁欝茂盛。
translation: Everywhere there are trees with flowers and fruits-the tamālā tree, the kanikara tree, the unsurpassed tree, the pattra tree, the sālā tree, the tilaka tree, the dragon-flower tree, the makura tree, the adhimukha tree, and the pāṭalā tree-that flourish.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡舍利、迦陵頻伽、俱計羅鳥等，於諸樹間，作微妙音。
translation: The parrot Śāriputra, kalaviṅka, and kukkuṭapāla trees make subtle sounds among the trees.

source_sentence: 於城內外，流泉浴池，常出好花——優鉢羅花、俱母那花、奔吒利迦花等，如是富貴，種種裝嚴。」
translation: Inside and outside the city, there are fountains and pools that always produce beautiful flowers--upalas, kumbhas, puṇḍarikas, and so forth--that are rich and luxurious and decorated in various ways."

source_sentence: 佛告苾芻：「爾時月光天子，於市肆街巷及城四門，堆聚金銀珍寶、象馬車乘、飲食衣服、臥具醫藥、種種莊嚴之物，即擊金鼓，告令眾人：『月光天子，以種種財物，普施一切。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "At the time, the Candraprabha goddess went into the marketplaces and the four gates of the city and piled up gold, silver, and precious treasures, elephants, horses, chariots, food, clothing, bedding, medicine, and all sorts of adornments, and then beat his golden drum and told the crowd, 'The Candraprabha goddess gives all kinds of goods to everyone.

source_sentence: 隨意所須，求者相給。』
translation: Whatever you need, give it to those who ask for it.'

source_sentence: 爾時南贍部洲，一切眾生，皆至王城，求其所施，無不豐足，得大富貴，無一貧乏及徒行者。
translation: At the time, all the sentient beings on the southern continent of Jambudvīpa went to the king's city, asked for their alms, and they were all provided for, attaining great wealth and prosperity, and there was no one who was poor or inactive.

source_sentence: 「爾時月光天子，復自思惟：『雖諸眾生無有貧乏，對我所用猶未齊等。』
translation: "At the time, the Candraprabha god thought to himself, 'Even though there aren't any sentient beings who are poor, what they need from me still isn't equal.'

source_sentence: 復以細妙衣服、最上珍寶、頭冠瓔珞、臥具飲食等，施諸眾生，富貴莊嚴，皆如月光天子身；城邑宮殿，樓閣園林，種種嚴飾，如忉利天。
translation: He then bestows on sentient beings fine and delicate clothing, the highest treasures, crowns, jewelry, bedding, and food, all of which are rich and ornate, just like the body of the moon-bright celestial, and his cities, palaces, mansions, and gardens are decorated in various ways like those of the Heaven of Thirty-three.

source_sentence: 「有七十二百千那由他人，常止此城；有二千五百大臣，有二輔相：一名大月、二名持地，容貌端正，福德淳厚，智慧深遠，高才博識，恒以十善，化諸眾生。
translation: "There are 72,000 nayutas who always stay in this city, and there are 2,500 ministers with two assistants, one great-moon and the other earth-holding, who are of noble appearance, of simple virtue, profound in wisdom, and highly talented and knowledgeable, and who always teach sentient beings the ten virtues.

source_sentence: 「是時大月，於夜睡眠，而作一夢，王戴天冠，變黑煙色，復有鬼來，就王頭上，奪冠而去。
translation: "At the time, Candragupta was asleep at night and had a dream in which the crown the king was wearing turned black and smoky, and a ghost came along and got on the king's head, snatched the crown, and left.

source_sentence: 作是夢已，憂惶驚懼，恐有不祥而自思惟：『我王慈愍，惠施一切，求者不違。
translation: After having this dream, he was terrified and frightened, fearing bad fortune, and thought to himself, 'My king is kind and compassionate, and he gives generously to all who ask for it.

source_sentence: 必有惡人，來乞王頭。』
translation: Some bad person will surely come and beg for the king's head.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即用七寶，造一寶頭，如有乞者，以此代之。
translation: After that thought, he made a jeweled head out of seven treasures, and if anyone begs for it, he'll use it as a substitute.

source_sentence: 「時持地輔相，亦作一夢，見月光身，四體分散。
translation: "The earth-supporting consigliere then also had a dream in which he saw the moonlight body with its four bodies scattered.

source_sentence: 即召婆羅門，占夢凶吉。
translation: He summoned a Brāhmaṇa to divine the dream's fortune.

source_sentence: 婆羅門曰：『此夢甚惡，必有遠人，來乞王頭。』
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, 'This dream is very bad; someone from far away must have come to beg for the king's head.'

source_sentence: 持地聞已，悲泣感傷：『云何我王，有斯大禍？』
translation: After hearing this, Jyoti was overcome with sorrow and grief, saying, 'How did this great misfortune happen to our king?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，一萬二千五百親位大臣，俱作惡夢，幢幡倒地，金鼓不鳴，恩愛別離，悲啼哭泣。
translation: "At the time, 12,500 ministers in their positions all had a bad dream in which a banner fell to the ground, a gold drum stopped beating, affection was parted, and they lamented and wept.

source_sentence: 如是夢已，共相議曰：『王若不吉，一切眾生，誰為救濟？
translation: After such a dream, they all discussed it with each other, saying, 'If the king is unlucky, who will rescue all sentient beings?'

source_sentence: 我等云何而得安隱？』
translation: How can we be at peace?'

source_sentence: 「時月光天子，又告大臣：『盡我壽命，施於眾生，不得間斷。』
translation: "The then-Moonlight Celestial also told his minister, 'Give to sentient beings for the rest of my life, so that they won't be cut off.'

source_sentence: 「爾時香醉山中，有大婆羅門，名曰惡眼，聰明多智，善解技術。
translation: "It was then that there was a great brāhmaṇa named Evil Eye on Mount Heungjeok, who was wise and had great knowledge and an excellent understanding of technology.

source_sentence: 知月光天子，於城四門，大開施會，擊鼓宣令，普告四方：『求者供給，而無乏少。』
translation: He knew that the god Candraprabha opened a great almsgiving at the city's four gates, beat a drum, and announced the order, telling the four directions, 'No one who asks for it will be denied a lack of offerings.'

source_sentence: 『我今往彼，乞於王頭。』
translation: ' 'Now, I'll go there and beg for the king's head.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，下香醉山。
translation: After saying this, he descended into the mountain of fragrant drunkenness.

source_sentence: 「山有天人，知婆羅門來乞王頭，悲痛傷歎：『苦哉，苦哉！
translation: "On that mountain, there were gods and humans who knew that Brāhmaṇa had come to beg for the king's head and were saddened and sorrowful, saying, 'Oh, this is painful!

source_sentence: 此王心懷慈愍，利樂群生；如若命終，世間薄祐。』
translation: This king is compassionate at heart and benefits all living beings; if his life ends, the world will be thinly veiled.'

source_sentence: 作是語時，天地昏黑、日月不現、泉井枯乾、暴風卒起、吹砂走石、樹木摧折、大地震動，有如是不祥之相。
translation: When he says this, the heavens and earth become dark, the sun and moon don't appear, springs and wells dry up, a violent wind suddenly arises, sand blows away rocks, trees break down, and a great earthquake shakes the city, and there are such ominous appearances.

source_sentence: 「去城不遠，有一仙人，身具五通，名彌濕嚩弭怛囉，與五百眷屬，常以慈愍，護念眾生，見此徵祥，甚懷憂惱，告摩拏嚩迦曰：『必有災禍，臨於民主。
translation: "Not far from the city, there's an immortal with the five powers named Mihirvāmitra and his 500 retinues who are always mindful of sentient beings and compassionate, and when they see these signs, they're deeply troubled and tell Manāḍaka, 'There's bound to be a disaster that comes to democracy.

source_sentence: 我等云何而為救護？』
translation: What can we do to help?'

source_sentence: 虛空中緊那羅眾及諸天人，皆悉下淚，如降微雨；一切人民，心懷驚怖。
translation: In the sky, the crowds of the Tathāgatas and gods all wept like a gentle rain, and all the people were terrified.

source_sentence: 「時惡眼婆羅門，將欲至城。
translation: "The malevolent-eyed Brahmans were about to reach the city.

source_sentence: 護城天人，詣月光天子前：『今有惡人，從香醉山來，懷殺害心，欲乞王頭，不得聽之。
translation: The celestials protecting the city went to the Candraprabha god, saying, 'Now, there's a bad man from Mount Incense Drunkenness who wants to beg for the king's head with murderous intentions, but I won't allow him to listen.

source_sentence: 宜保愛自身，固安聖體。』
translation: It's better to protect yourself and secure the holy body.'

source_sentence: 「王既聞已，心生踊躍，歎言：『善哉！
translation: "After hearing this, the king perked up and praised him, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 令我圓滿檀波羅蜜。』
translation: Make me perfect the perfection of the perfection of giving.'

source_sentence: 「時惡眼婆羅門，即入王城；守門天人，見婆羅門，神情醜惡，隔住門外，終不放入。
translation: "The malevolent-eyed Brāhmaṇa then entered the king's city, and the celestials guarding the gate saw him with an ugly expression, barred him from the gate, and never let him in.

source_sentence: 時月光天子，知彼來至、不放入城，即告宰臣大月：『有婆羅門，從香醉山來，欲見於我。
translation: Knowing that they had arrived and wouldn't enter the city, the god Candraprabha then addressed the vizier Mahêśvara, 'A Brāhmaṇa has come from Mount Sumeru and wants to see me.

source_sentence: 令彼門司，不得障礙。』
translation: Tell that gatekeeper not to obstruct him.'

source_sentence: 「大月受教，白守門天人：『即令放入。』
translation: "*Tathāgata accepted his teaching and told the gatekeeper, 'Tell him to put it in.'

source_sentence: 大月見已，問婆羅門曰：『汝來至此，有何所求？』
translation: After he saw them, Candragupta asked the Brāhmaṇa, 'What do you want to come here?'

source_sentence: 「婆羅門言：『我聞月光天子，慈愍有情，設大施會，若有所求，一切無悋。
translation: "The Brāhmaṇa said, 'I've heard that the Candraprabha goddess has compassion for sentient beings and has set up a great generosity meeting, so if he asks for anything, it won't be stingy.

source_sentence: 今來至此，欲乞王頭。』
translation: Now, I've come here to ask the king's head.'

source_sentence: 大月告言：『婆羅門！
translation: The Candragupta told him, 'Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 王頭膿血所成，終歸爛壞，汝今乞得，有何所用？
translation: The pus and blood on the king's head will eventually rot, so what use would you get from begging for it now?

source_sentence: 我有七寶頭，復有種種金銀珍寶，俱奉施之，乃令子孫永得大富。』
translation: I have a head of seven treasures, and I also have various metals and silver treasures that I give to my descendants, so they'll always be rich.'

source_sentence: 「婆羅門言：『我本乞頭，非為珍寶。』
translation: "The brāhmaṇa said, 'I originally begged for my head, not for the treasures.'

source_sentence: 「時二大臣，啼泣雨淚，悲痛憂惱：『我等云何得免斯害？』
translation: "The two ministers then wept and rained tears, grieving and sorrowing, 'How could we have been spared this harm?'

source_sentence: 「時婆羅門，即詣王前，見已頂禮，住立一面，合掌白言：『聞王慈愍，普施一切。
translation: "The Brāhmaṇa then went to the king, paid homage when he saw him, stood to one side, put his palms together, and said, 'I've heard that the king is kind and compassionate and gives generously to all living things.

source_sentence: 我今遠來，只乞王頭。
translation: Now, I've come a long way to ask the king's head.

source_sentence: 願垂慈愍，歡喜布施。』
translation: Please have mercy on us and rejoice in our generosity.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『菩薩志求無上智，　　安住最勝清淨法，　　願垂慈愍速捨頭，　　圓滿檀度波羅蜜。』
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, 'Bodhisattva aspires to unsurpassed knowledge, abiding in the most excellent and pure dharma, may you have compassion and quickly relinquish your head to completely fulfill the perfection of giving.'

source_sentence: 「時月光天子，即起合掌而說偈言：「『父母所生不淨身，　　汝求我頭歡喜捨，　　滿爾本願稱心歸，　　令我速成菩提果。』」
translation: "The moon-bright celestial then rose, joined his palms, and spoke the verse, saying, 'An impure body born from a father and mother, you seek my head and joyfully abandon it. Fulfilling this past vow, I wholeheartedly return to it, so that I can quickly achieve the fruit of enlightenment.'"

source_sentence: 「說此偈已，白婆羅門言：『勿嫌我頭，骨髓膿血，皮肉相連，無有清淨，而即施之，滿汝本願。』
translation: "After speaking this verse, he said to the Brāhmaṇa, 'Don't mind that my head is made of marrow, bones, pus, blood, and skin, and there's nothing pure about it; give it to him instead, and fulfill your original vow.'

source_sentence: 「時婆羅門，心大歡喜。
translation: "The Brāhmaṇa then rejoiced greatly at heart.

source_sentence: 王欲截頭，即去頭冠；是時南贍部洲，一切頭冠悉皆落地，人各驚惶。
translation: When the king wanted to cut off his head, he removed his crown; at that point, all the crowns of heads on the southern continent fell to the ground, and people were terrified.

source_sentence: 輔相二人，不忍見王捨棄身命，即於彼處，自盡其壽；以善根力，生大梵宮。
translation: The two assistants couldn't bear to see the king give up his life, so they ended their own lives there and, by the power of their good roots, were born in the palace of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 「時菩摩夜叉，於虛空中，高聲唱言：『苦哉，天子！
translation: "Up in the sky, Pūrṇa and Yakṣa then raised their voices and said, 'Oh, my god!

source_sentence: 今將命終。』
translation: Now, I'm about to die.'

source_sentence: 復有百千億人，奔詣王宮，啼泣下淚，傷愛別離。
translation: Again, a hundred billion people rushed to the king's palace, weeping and wailing, saddened by their separation.

source_sentence: 王即說法安慰，令發道心。
translation: The king then spoke words of comfort, causing them to arouse the mind for enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「婆羅門言：『王若捨頭，宜於淨處。』
translation: "The brāhmaṇas said, 'If the king were to abandon his head, it would be better to go to a pure place.'

source_sentence: 「王即告言：『我有一苑，名摩尼寶藏，花果茂盛，流泉浴池，種種莊嚴，最為第一；於斯捨頭，汝意云何？』
translation: "The king then told them, 'I have a mango grove called Mani-pottery, where flowers and fruits grow in abundance, fountains flow, and baths are filled with various kinds of adornment, the most distinguished of them all; what do you think about abandoning your head there?'

source_sentence: 「婆羅門言：『宜速往彼。』
translation: "The Brāhmaṇa said, 'It's better to go there quickly.'

source_sentence: 「王即携劒，往彼苑中，立瞻蔔樹下，告婆羅門言：『我今捨頭，汝來截之。』
translation: "The king then took them with him and went to that park, stood under the campaka tree, and told the Brāhmaṇa, 'Now, I'll let go of my head; come and cut it off.'

source_sentence: 「婆羅門曰：『王不自斷，令我持刃，非布施行。』
translation: "The Brāhmaṇa said, 'The king didn't cut it himself; he asked me to carry the blade, not to carry it out.'

source_sentence: 「時有護苑天人，見是事已，悲泣涕淚，告婆羅門曰：『汝大惡人！
translation: "When the gods and goddesses who guarded the park saw this, they wept and sobbed, and told the Brāhmaṇa, 'You great evil man!

source_sentence: 月光天子，慈愍一切，普利群生。
translation: 'Moonlight Prince, you have compassion for all and universally benefit all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 何以此處，害天子命？』
translation: Why would he harm the life of the Son of God in this place?'

source_sentence: 「王告天人：『莫作是言，障礙勝事。
translation: "The king told the celestials, 'Don't say that, for it's an obstruction to something wonderful.

source_sentence: 我於過去無量生中，為大國王；於此苑內，千度捨頭。
translation: In my countless past lives, I was the king of a great country, and I abandoned my head a thousand times in this garden.

source_sentence: 時諸天人，皆無障礙。
translation: All the gods and humans then were unobstructed.

source_sentence: 昔濟餓虎，捨身命等，超於慈氏四十劫，彼時天人，亦不障礙。
translation: In the past, I saved a hungry tiger and sacrificed my life for 40 eons, surpassing that of the Mercys, but the gods and humans at that time weren't obstructed either.

source_sentence: 汝於今日，發隨喜心，當獲勝利。』
translation: Today, you must give rise to the intention to rejoice, and you will reap great benefits.'

source_sentence: 「月光天子復告天龍八部一切賢聖：『我今捨頭，不求輪王、不求生天、不求魔王、不求帝釋、不求梵王，為求無上正等正覺，令未受化者迴心受化、已受化者速得解脫，得解脫者圓證寂滅究竟彼岸。
translation: "Again, the moon-bright celestial addressed all the gods, dragons, and the eight groups of sages, 'Now, I renounce my head and don't seek the wheel-turning king, birth in the heavens, the king of Māra, Indra, or the king of Brahmā in order to pursue unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, so that those who haven't yet been transformed will change their minds and be transformed, those who have been transformed will quickly attain liberation, and those who have attained liberation will completely realize the other shore of extinction.

source_sentence: 又願命終之後，舍利如白芥子，於摩尼寶藏苑，建一大塔，令一切眾生，禮拜供養見聞隨喜；命終之後，皆得生天，發菩提心，出生死界。』
translation: May the relics be as white as mustard seeds when his life ends and a large stūpa be built in the Manichea treasure house, so that all sentient beings may venerate, make offerings, see, hear, and rejoice, and then at the end of their lives, they'll all be born in the heavens, give rise to the mind of enlightenment, and escape the realm of birth-and-death.'

source_sentence: 「發是願已，婆羅門曰：『王捨內財，甚為稀有，於未來世，速成佛道。』
translation: "After he made this vow, the Brāhmaṇa said, 'It's rare for a king to part with his wealth and possessions, so he'll quickly achieve the Buddha Way in the future.'

source_sentence: 作是語時，王以首髮，繫無憂樹枝，即執利劒，自斷其頭。
translation: When he said this, the king tied his hair on a branch of the tree of no sorrow, took a sharp point, and cut off his own head.

source_sentence: 「爾時三千大千世界六種振動，於虛空中，天人讚言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: "At that moment, six things in the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds vibrated, and in the sky, gods and humans praised him, saying, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 今月光天子當得成佛。』
translation: Now, Candradeva will become a buddha.'

source_sentence: 復雨優鉢羅花、鉢納摩花、俱母那花、曼陀羅花，及沈香、粖香、旃檀之香，種種供養；即以旃檀香木，焚燒遺體，收其舍利，於摩尼苑及四衢路，各起一塔，恒時供養。
translation: He also rained down flowers of upalaka, padma, kuṇḍinagara, and mandāra, as well as incense of sambac, sandalwood, and sandalwood, and made offerings of various kinds. He then burned his remains with sandalwood, collected his relics, and erected a stūpa in the Mani Park and on each of the four roads to offer them up for constant worship.

source_sentence: 現在未來一切眾生，於此苑中，行住坐臥，及於塔前，瞻禮供養；命終之後，生六欲天，及梵天上。」
translation: Now, in the future, all sentient beings will walk, stand, sit, lay down, and venerate and make offerings in front of these stūpas; when their lives end, they'll be born in the Heaven of the Six Desires or on top of the Brahma Heaven."

source_sentence: 爾時佛告諸苾芻：「往昔月光天子者，今我身是；大月、持地二輔相者，今舍利弗、大目乾連是；惡眼婆羅門者，今提婆達多是。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks, "That was the moon-bright celestial in the past, and now I am him; that was the auxiliary marks of Mahāmoon and Earth-holder, and now Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana are them; and that was the malevolent-eyed Brāhmaṇa, and now Devadatta is him.

source_sentence: 由是因緣，先於佛前，而請入滅。」
translation: Because of these reasons, I first asked the Buddha to grant me entry into nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻，聞佛所說，皆大歡憙，信受奉行。
translation: When the monks heard what the Buddha taught, they were all greatly elated, believed, and approved.

source_sentence: 禮佛而退。
translation: They bowed their heads to the Buddha and withdrew.

source_sentence: 佛說月光菩薩經
translation: Foshuo yueshang pusa jing
